page.title: 10The Golden Horseshoe,Exford
page.content: The Golden Horseshoe is a long distance ride which starts at Exford every year,in May. The horses and riders arrive on the Monday so that they can be inspected by the Vet. On Tuesday the competitors do a 50mile ride over Exmoor. Their average speed must be 8m.p.h. From the playground we saw them coming back,this year two of the children made a tally count,on colour of horses and number of riders. Some of the horses were lame,they were all sweating. On Wednesday they do the 25mile ride in the other direction. The Prizegiving takes place in the Auction field,in the afternoon. Any rider with no penalties is given a golden horseshoe.There are also Silver and Bronze awards and rosettes.On Thursday Exford is all Quiet again.
